channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Texas sues utility that caused largest wildfire in state history, over $1 billion in damages
item.description: The lawsuit filed by state Attorney General Ken Paxton accuses Southwestern Public Service Company, which operates in Texas as Xcel Energy, of neglige...

item.title: Hyundai and Kia on the hook for $500 million-plus, millions of anti-theft repairs
item.description: Minnesota Attorney General Keith Ellison announced the settlement, which was reached with 35 states.

item.title: Billy Crystal, Larry David and Others Remember Rob Reiner as a ‘Master Story Teller’
item.description: A group of prominent figures issued a statement memorializing Mr. Reiner and his wife, Michele Singer Reiner. “We were their friends, and we will miss...

item.title: Warner Bros. Urges Shareholders to Reject Paramount Takeover Bid, Saying Ellisons ‘Misled’ Them
item.description: The claim was made as part of Warner Bros. Discovery’s dismissal of Paramount’s hostile takeover offer.

item.title: Trump Orders Blockade of Some Oil Tankers to and From Venezuela
item.description: The move is an escalation of military operations and a pressure campaign against Nicolás Maduro, Venezuela’s leader. But its scope and economic impact...

item.title: Klarna CEO says he feels ‘gloomy’ because AI is developing so quickly it’ll soon be able to do his entire job
item.description: “My work to me is a super important part of who I am,” Sebastian Siemiatkowski said.

item.title: In a frozen luxury housing market, buyers are asking to ‘try before you buy’ and having sleepovers in multimillion-dollar mansions
item.description: Sellers are trying new tactics to get the most money for their homes.

item.title: 33-year-old woman charged with attempted mayhem after Mississippi Walmart sells razorblade bread
item.description: “The health and safety of our customers is always a top priority,” Walmart said in a statement.

item.title: Harvard Secretly Investigates Students Over Larry Summers Video on Epstein
item.description: The students face discipline for recording Mr. Summers, the former Harvard president, discussing his ties to Jeffrey Epstein in a Harvard class.

item.title: Suspect in Bondi Beach Killings Is Charged With Murder and Terrorism
item.description: The Australian authorities said the 24-year-old man, who had been shot by the police, woke from a coma on Tuesday afternoon.

item.title: UK Rejoins EU’s Erasmus Student Exchange Program That It Left After Brexit
item.description: The government said it would pay about $760 million to allow young Britons to take part in 2027.

item.title: Trump Orders Blockade of Some Oil Tankers to and From Venezuela
item.description: The move is an escalation of military operations and a pressure campaign against Nicolás Maduro, Venezuela’s leader. But its scope and economic impact...

item.title: Surviving Bondi Suspect Charged With Terrorism and Murder
item.description: The surviving suspect in the mass shooting at Bondi Beach in Sydney, Australia, on Sunday, in which at least 15 people were killed, has been charged w...

item.title: The 25 Most Notable Movies of 2025: ‘KPop Demon Hunters,’ ‘Roofman’ and More
item.description: We polled film fans in the newsroom. These are the titles that stuck with us this year.

item.title: Trump Revised Chevron’s Venezuela Deal. Maduro’s Oil Trader Profited.
item.description: A firm controlled by a businessman tied to a seized tanker carrying Venezuelan oil has sold millions of barrels from a Chevron-operated oil field.
